alert.note: Alert for Anasco; Las Marias; Mayaguez; San Sebastian (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 10:22PM ADT until September 19 at 3:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Anasco County in Puerto Rico... Las Marias County in Puerto Rico... Mayaguez County in Puerto Rico... San Sebastian County in Puerto Rico... * Until 200 AM AST. * At 922 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain continuing across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of several mainstem rivers as well as creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Rio Anasco reached a maximum stage of 26.12 feet where flooding can be expected downstream in Barrio Espino for a few more hours. Rio Guanjibo in Hormigueros is still rising slowly from a stage of 20.36 feet where the river is out of its banks and flooding highway 114 and highway 347. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Anasco; Las Marias; Mayaguez; San Sebastian
